set.html: You've finally found me. Very well.
I'm who wrote this game. Who thought the plot...
Sketched the warrior and friends on paper...
Put the code together, prepared the maps...
I'm who decided what the characters should do and say...
I also decided how this game should end...
...and this is the ending I thought.
I mostly did it few hours during my weekends...
...sometime by the train, while going back home from my job.
It took a lot of time, despite...
...on par with any good standard. Anyway, it's my first RPG so...
Oh, good. So I decided that the player have to ask something to me.
I must go to some good psychiatrist.
Anyway, I did it for fun.
I wanted to face the problems of making an RPG...
From graphics to code and design.
Yes, I know that the final product looks and plays bad and...
...working alone is not the best way for getting things done.
But in this way I think I've touched a bit of everything...
It's just a matter of life choices, you know?
I hope you've liked at least some bits of this game.
Why? Why you've done this to me?
Me? The warrior or the hero?
Ah ah ah! Well... that was fun.
The reason I've decided to end this game so dramatically...
Yes. I'm not going to bore or lecture you but...
Good and bad are often measured using cliches and common sense...
...which limits your own will and prevent you...
But, as I said, I'm not going to be boring.
The game mostly speaks by itself.
Why you're leaving this message here...
...if the game is enough for you?
I have a purpose in my breaking the fourth wall...
...in my explaining how I've made this game...
...and in my telling my own thoughts about the plot I've wrote.
All these things are my own opinions. It's my own way.
You're able to express yourself. Create your own world...
...where the Warrior, Blamage and Whimage lives and...
All you have to do is trying.
You can start changing the dialogues of this game...
Removing this glitched world and replacing it with something good...
...or write a new story from scratch. With your own tools.
But remember to always think with your own head.
You have to judge them with your own head...
That's all. I wanted to put some kind of staff roll here...
...but it's quite ridiculous. Time to go back...
I... really wanted save this world.
I... don't know... it's full of...
Seems that your duty isn't over yet.
You have to save this world again...
And I'll help you once more.
Please, touch me, heal your wounds and save your game.
I heard these same words when I woke up...
Everything was meaningless at that time so...
Who said these words to you?
Cough. Cough. We're losing time here...
HP MP ATK DEF MATK MDEF XP NEXT
I'm... scared... we've to go back...
What is the meaning of these symbols?
I... I really don't know why...
Why I've been kidnapped by goblins.
Humans and goblins aren't surely best friends but...
Anyway. Let's go back to my village.
It's on the west from here.
You are going back home. You are going back home.
This is your home. This is your home. This is your home.
...in order to make the game code...
That's why there are few spells.
Don't stop here. We've to keep going.
Whimage is right! I'll ask to them.
I feel my legs shaking and I'm getting confused...
Leave me here. I'll reach you in a while.
We can't, Blamage. We will wait here with you.
You can't. We can't lose time here...
...we're all getting tired and sick. We've...
...to find how to leave this place...
I said no. You have to help the hero in battle.
Ok, Blamage. We'll be back soon.
Good. It looks like you're going to save me twice!
You have to go now. I'll be safe.
Please, hero... I've a bad feeling...
We've to go back. Blamage is in danger...
I haven't seen Blamage. Where is he?
I don't know. I really don't know!
I probably went back where we left him...
I don't know for sure if I did it or not.
Please. For the last time... we've to go back.
I'm trying to go back, Whimage!
You and your damn God killed Blamage.
I'm going to kill you, hero.
We were happy before your arrival.
We lived in that small village but...
And now... you've brought us here...
7. The hero will lose its mentor.
8. The hero will face its final battle.
9. The hero will go back home.
You have to tell me what is happening!
Now you can go back to your life.
My life? What is my life?
I can't remember anything before this...
I'm not obviously talking with you...
I... I'm the hero! You said that at the beginning!
I'm sure that the hero already knows...
...the difference between himself and the Warrior.
The warrior? Who is the warrior?
You are the warrior. A sketchy avatar of the hero.
There isn't anything more to understand.
